summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2019 between attorneys from Winston & Strawn LLP (representing a client) and federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York. The emails primarily concern scheduling a meeting to discuss a grand jury subpoena and a potential voluntary interview, with the prosecutors also providing case information and addressing client safety concerns.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.role: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP, Defense Attorney
persons.context: Lead attorney representing a client who received a grand jury subpoena; she is coordinating meetings with federal prosecutors and discussing legal strategy, including a potential proffer agreement.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney working with Suzanne Bloom on the case; she is copied on emails and attended a scheduled meeting with prosecutors.

persons.name: Cristina I. Calvar
persons.role: Associate Attorney at Winston & Strawn LLP
persons.context: Associate attorney at Winston & Strawn who is also involved in the case correspondence and scheduling.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP working together on the defense of a client subpoenaed by the SDNY grand jury.
Both are attorneys at Winston & Strawn LLP, with Calvar assisting Bloom in correspondence and scheduling with federal prosecutors.
Bloom, as defense counsel, is in communication with federal prosecutors regarding her client's compliance with a grand jury subpoena and potential cooperation.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to an individual (Bloom's client).

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The initial date the subpoenaed individual was to appear before the grand jury; this date was adjourned/held in abeyance.

events.title: Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: A meeting was held at 9:30 a.m. between defense attorneys Bloom and Hudgens and the federal prosecution team.

events.title: Phone Call Regarding Threats
events.description: A phone call occurred where Bloom discussed threatening communications received by her client's husband with prosecutors.

events.title: Start of Prosecutor's Trial
events.description: A prosecutor mentioned having a short trial starting on this date, which affected meeting availability.

locations: Winston & Strawn LLP, 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193
Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document centers on a grand jury subpoena dated July 5, 2019, issued by the SDNY to an individual represented by Winston & Strawn attorneys.
Prosecutors provided the defense with transcripts of court proceedings, docket numbers for related civil cases, and a standard proffer agreement.
Prosecutors revealed they possess contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the client, showing calls with multiple underage girls.
The defense reported that the client's husband had received threatening communications, and prosecutors strongly advised reporting such threats to law enforcement.
The emails show extensive efforts to schedule a meeting for a potential voluntary interview or attorney proffer, with the original grand jury appearance date held in abeyance.
